page.description: Adds a data-bound Video Player control to a component that can be used to play and record videos. The *[ui:VideoRecorderPlayer]* can only be used in Cordova applications.

description.p: You may have noticed that there are several video player controls in the UX component. The *[ui:VideoRecorderPlayer]* control shown above (found in the *[ui:More...]* controls dialog in the *[ui:Data Controls]* section) can be used to add a video player to a component that is data-bound and will operate in a disconnected environment. The *[ui:VideoRecorderPlayer]* can also record video in a Cordova mobile application.

The term "Data-bound" means that the control reads its data, in this case the location of a video file, from a database on a server. The data is loaded from the server to the client, such as a mobile phone.
The term 'Disconnected' refers to the fact that the user's device does not need to have a continuous connection to the server in order for the application function.
The data-bound *[ui:VideoRecorderPlayer]* control allow users to playback existing videos and record new videos in Cordova mobile applications.
Event definitions for the data bound *[ui:VideoRecorderPlayer]* control can be set using the [Control properties] property.

JavaScript methods are available for the *[ui:VideoRecorderPlayer]* control. Methods can be used for recording and playback. To call the methods, you must first get a reference to the JavaScript object for the *[ui:VideoRecorderPlayer]* control using the [{dialog.object}.getControl()] method:
See [Video Player methods] for *[ui:VideoRecorderPlayer]* control methods.
